rComments: He gets off topic so much. It's really hard to follow. He is extremely intelligent. I just wish he would've slowed down. Interesting material over all. He barely followed the syllabus which made things more confusing. The class isn't too bad, he seems to be very aware and understanding that he gets off topic so he extends due dates and is flexible

Prof. Marlovits is by far one of the most animated professors I've had. He's funny and he will check in with you to make sure your engaged. He doesn't do power points but he does write key points for the note takers, or projects his notes on a screen. If you attend his lectures and do the readings he brings up in class, you'll do fine.

I thought he was fantastic and I really loved his class.  I think part of it may have been my newfound love of anthropology, but I also believe that an exceptional professor vastly contributes to the level of interest and retention of class material.  I would recommend his class to  anyone who truly loves learning. I disagree with the low ratings.

John was a great professor. He is very knowledgeable and well read. His lectures are not as structured as other courses (no powerpoint presentations) but if you listen to and actively engage in his lectures then you will learn a lot! He's also very enthusiastic and funny!

I love John. He is good looking, very smart, funny, and punk rock. He is hard to follow because of his free flowing lecture style. If you stop trying to take notes and just listen to him you will do well in his class. Always makes great pop culture references and shows good films.
Its really hard to follow him. I get so lost during lecture. He also tends to stray off and get off topic. He jokes around alot too. Hes a nice guy, but I really can't learn anything from him.

He can speak kindof in a stream-of-consciousness way but he's really smart and well read and has alot of information to pass on.  He's a funny guy, I'd disagree with saying he's boring, you just have to listen, he drops some real gems.  If you're not expecting the traditional professor, then you're in for something good.

Took Marlovits for Anth 133: Narratives of the Popular. Class was interesting and kind of organic and free in form as far as lecture and class discussion went. Really nice guy and helpful too if you need help. Really smart, overall cool guy.  He looks like he could be Daniel Day Lewis' brother (like no joke!).

He was the most useless teacher ever. He talks about the most boring things for the entire class period and he goes off topic way too often. his class wasn't too hard but he doesn't give great feedback on the essays. I don't recommend taking his class.

I admit that he was extremely boring and seemed to ramble on and on about whatever he wanted to talk about. He gave you feedback on essays but in order for you to improve, you had to do exactly what he wanted on the essays. I didn't find him particularly useful but he wasn't the worst teacher I've ever had.

He is the most boring teacher I've ever had. He talks way too much and no one seems to know what's going on. Half the class falls asleep. He gives unhelpful feedback on essays causing you to get a low grade. =(
